result.execSummary:
The defendant Travell Nyckolas Saffold was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 10/09/2015 @ 1:30pm, Br-38

miscConds.notes:
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, DNA surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the DOC's, during period of probation or civil judgment.
- Restitution is set at zero.
- No firearms/weapons. 48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

- Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling and continue programming.
- Mental Health Evaluation if warranted.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
- Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
- Maintain absolute sobriety. No drugs. No alcohol.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- No Contact with victim, Thomas S., without prior court approval.
- Maintain employment.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED pending review
*10/9/2015  STAY LIFTED.  To serve 45 days straight time.  No good time credit.  Order for Commitment signed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travell Nyckolas Saffold

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Travell Nyckolas Saffold not in court.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per email from Probation Dept., defendant is currently in absconder status.  Court ordered defendant to serve 45 days of the condition time; straight time.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.

Defendant Travell Nyckolas Saffold in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #2, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT #1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  The Court finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
Defendant sentenced to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 15 MONTHS.  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 45 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Mental Health Evaluation if warranted.  
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Thomas S., 
   without prior court approval.   
* Maintain employment.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, DNA surcharge, and supervision fees as 
   determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
* Restitution is set at zero.
**COURT ORDERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 38 ON 10-9-2015 AT 1:30 PM. 
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
 Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.   
Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  mld

Defendant Travell Nyckolas Saffold in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Due to Branch 4 in Trial, case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing in Branch 4 on 6-17-2015 at 8:30 am.  Parties will also be exploring a possible deferred prosecution agreement.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld

Defendant Travell Nyckolas Saffold in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Status Conference held off the record.  Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 5-12-2015 at 8:30 am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld

Defendant Travell Nyckolas Saffold in court.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Per telephone call to the Public Defender's Office, the defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Case is adjourned to Branch 4 on 4-9-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Thomas S. or Quinton M., no firearms and no violations of the law.   mld

Defendant Travell Nyckolas Saffold in court.  Evan K Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears without counsel.  Court grants the defendant an adjournment to retain counsel.  Case adjourned for Status of Counsel in Branch 4 on 4-2-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact Thomas S. or Quinton M., and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.   mld
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Thomas S. or Quinton M.

Defendant Travell Nyckolas Saffold in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Travell Nyckolas Saffold in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
